An AO3 Feed for the Star Wars - All Media Types tag.

Icon from the Star Wars App.

title: Camaraderie
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2QjZbEv

by DragonWhiskers

Kylo waits not so patiently while Rey meditates on the building her saberstaff. The Knights of Ren decide he needs some company.

Words: 1376, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

Series: Part 21 of The Things We Crave

  • Fandoms: Star Wars Sequel Trilogy, Star Wars - All Media Types
  • Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
  • Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Ben Solo | Kylo Ren, Rey (Star Wars), Knights of Ren
  • Relationships: Kylo Ren/Rey, Rey/Ben Solo | Kylo Ren, Kylo Ren & Rey
  • Additional Tags: I finally did it! All of the Knights show up…in one room!, Meditation, Drinking, Force Choking, Attempt at Humor, comradery, Kylo’s a bit of a mess, Enos is my precious li'l Knight, Aderis is a cocky jerk at the best of times


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2QjZbEv

blog.name: starwarsfanlove
blog.title: I need someone to show me my place in all this

summary: Supreme Leader Ren, Kylo Ren fanfic
title: Supreme Leader Ren, Kylo Ren fanfic
body:
Author’s note:

While I liked the Ben Solo in Snoke’s Throne Room scene, overall, I prefer JJ Abram’s portrayal of Kylo Ren - strong, intimidating, explosive, beautiful. 

Rian Johnson’s Ben Solo is unkept, soft, all over the place, and rugged-looking.

 I get that Kylo Ren’s character is unraveling, but, idk. The warmer colors. The zero-strength Kylo Ren. 🤔🤔 I don’t understand why Kylo wants Rey to understand him. A lot of things that happened in the movie seemed to be far from organic. 

I love TLJ, either way - for what it is to us Reylo shippers. But for this fic, think TFA-Kylo Ren/Ben Solo.

I mean, even as Kylo was dying, he was still beautiful. LOL. HAHA. A true prince. 

I mean, look at that eyeliner power! Also, he looks so young in TFA. (Just my preference I guess.) :D 

https://archiveofourown.org/works/13426206 (link to the original I posted months ago. I pasted the same story below. 

Hope you like it!

SUPREME LEADER REN.

“Do you think I am still a boy?” He hissed in his deep, menacing voice. His gaze, unfaltering; his tone, resolute as he takes a step towards her. “Do you think I need saving?” He continues in challenge.

“I am neither lost nor in need of saving.” He answers his own question in the woman’s stead. As he approached her, she stood her ground, strong and proud as she always has been; even amid his intimidating physique towering over her. “I do not need your redemption.” He spits at her.

“I am the Supreme Leader because I chose to be.” He ends all doubt, all question about him, his heritage, his conflict. “I am neither Snoke, nor Vader, nor Han Solo.”

“And I am ruler because it is my duty to kill the past. To bury it.”

With his eyes glaring, gleaming with his expressive watery gaze, he tells her, finally, with subtlest hint of tenderness, “Do not fear for me, mother. For there is nothing I have been more certain of than this role cast upon me.”

Finally, Leia’s straight, unfazed expression breaks. Her wrinkled lips quirk. And a light flashes through her eyes. It seemed, as it always had been, that the connection Han and Ben never had; she and Ben always shared. So, as her final words to the son she had always loved, to the son she had lost, and to the son she had found, she tells him with her coarse, aged voice, “Then, rule.”

At her words, at the sound of her voice so close to him after all these years, Ben involuntarily swallows the lump lodged in his throat; his Adam’s apple, bobbing down and back. The taste in his mouth, soured by grief, by the guilt of making her suffer for so long.

“Rule, Ben; righteously, justly, and fully.”

Then, Leia reaches up, to cup her son’s cheek; the warmth of his face, the way he fell into her touch, filled her chest with a fullness she’s known only once before; when she first held him in her arms.

Ben raises his hand and gently holds on to his mother’s spotted, aged one. And tenderly, he vows to her in farewell, “I will.” Then, his lips quirking like Leia’s, like his strong-willed mother, says, “After all, I’ve had the best teacher.”

You’ve thrust him upon men; doubting yourself, your ability to bring him home. All he ever needed was you, Leia. I’ve never met anyone so strong, so beautiful, and able as you. I only pray our son should be half as lucky as I am - to have met someone like you.

To salvage whatever morsel was left of our family, I was willing to sacrifice my life; as I have. I only hope our son knows, just how much he means to us - to me.

Tricky it is, the relationship of a father and son. Tender, that of a son and his mother. Where the latter is filled with love and compassion, the other is filled with disappointment, competition, and unrivaled expectation.

“Your father-” Her voice choked, amid the stifling cold air, her ragged breathing, the erupting Starkiller Base. “-He loved you! And you - you -”

His eyes widen, for less than a second, the image of his father, breaking into a smile, flashed through his eyes. For an instant, the man wondered - did the egotistical, money-hungry scoundrel think he would run away with him? From everything he’s achieved?

“You monster!”

No. A voice in his mind speaks, deep, familiar, - dead.

His father had come to him to show him how deeply he loved him - that for him, he was willing to give up his life, his past, - his future.

The cracking of the falling trees, the thundering blasts and explosions around him, once again, he hisses as he pulls himself up and, with a full fist, hits his side, deep velvet blood dripping from his suit to the white winter snow; embracing the searing pain from his fresh wound, fueling himself with the burning agony.

This love, the deep love of his fallen father, Ben Solo will never know.

“I love him, Leia.” Han breaks into his wife’s tender embrace.

And with a soft voice, herself unsure, she tells him nonetheless, “He knows.”

“Where,” the young Ben Solo’s voice broke, afraid to ask, to know the truth in what he feared. “Am I to go?” Fear - it always seemed to find him.

“To train with your uncle Luke,” His mother pets his fluffy dark hair, her smile, not quite reaching her beautiful brown eyes. “To become a Jedi Knight like your uncle, like your grandfather before him.” She tells him proudly.

Wide eyes look past his mother’s tender gaze to his father’s hard, conflicted ones, surprised by the expression in the boy’s face - asking him a question he did not understand, searching for an answer he did not know.

So, instead, and rather lamely, Han tells his pre-adolescent son, “Give them hell, kid.”

Ben’s eyes fall to the ground in disappointment, nodding halfheartedly.

“Is that all you’re bringing?” Luke pops out from his spaceshuttle, a grin plastered on his young, jovial face; gesturing to the calligraphy set between young Ben Solo’s arm.

The boy gives a small smile, nodding. And, with a simple wave of the hand, his uncle calls him over, unaware of the friend his nephew had brought along; whispering lies and deceit into his ear.

“It is dead.” Ben Solo now tells her amid the blood, metallic in stench, drying at the side of his head. The noise of the war stilled around them. “The Sith and the Jedi.” And, for the third time, he raises his hand to her in offer, “Rule with me, Rey.”

Promise me, Ben. Rule with righteousness, justice, and with your whole being.

Ben’s tender gaze, never once before her, faltered as he tells her again, and again, “I swear it.”

Uniform footsteps stop with a snap before him. Ben Solo turns from his commanding bridge and nods to his reporting military officers.

“General Solo.” An amphibious humanoid salutes him. “We’ve arrived.”

END.

Author’s note:

General Solo, what a tribute to his parent’s legacy! It would be incredible to see him addressed this manner in canon. (General Leia Organa + Han Solo) And no trace of the toxic/burdensome Skywalker name!! :oooooo

A snippet on what I see in Kylo Ren/Ben Solo’s character. I have great hopes for him. Also, I don’t want his character development to depend on another person - that’s just unrealistic. You grow because of yourself, because you chose it. All your actions return to you and what you’ve done. The best people around you can do is to influence you. But, that’s just it - it’s by your choice that you allow them to influence your character. (That’s how I live my life/perceive things actually, lol. As an adult, you can’t blame anyone for what you are. You’re an adult. If you don’t like something about yourself, only you can change it.)

Kylo Ren/Ben Solo’s character is incredibly complex. I love it so much. He could go either way - towards the light or the dark. But the possibility of reaching a middle ground. OF SOME NEW EMPIRE THAT ACTUALLY WORKS. WOW. That’s just next level. Here’s to hoping we get a strong character out of Ben Solo/Kylo Ren in IX! Make us proud, kid!

*General Solo - A tribute to his mother and his father. Like how couples name their children with a mash of their names.

“It is dead.” Ben Solo now tells her amid the blood, metallic in stench, drying at the side of his head. The noise of the war stilled around them. “The Sith and the Jedi.” And, for the third time, he raises his hand to her in offer, “Rule with me, Rey.”

Promise me, Ben. Rule with righteousness, justice, and with your whole being.

Ben’s tender gaze, never once before her, faltered as he tells her again, and again, “I swear it.”

Uniform footsteps stop with a snap before him. Ben Solo turns from his commanding bridge and nods to his reporting military officers.

“General Solo.” An amphibious humanoid salutes him. “We’ve arrived.”

END.

Author’s note:

General Solo, what a tribute to his parent’s legacy! It would be incredible to see him addressed this manner in canon. (General Leia Organa + Han Solo) And no trace of the toxic/burdensome Skywalker name!! :oooooo

A snippet on what I see in Kylo Ren/Ben Solo’s character. I have great hopes for him. Also, I don’t want his character development to depend on another person - that’s just unrealistic. You grow because of yourself, because you chose it. All your actions return to you and what you’ve done. The best people around you can do is to influence you. But, that’s just it - it’s by your choice that you allow them to influence your character. (That’s how I live my life/perceive things actually, lol. As an adult, you can’t blame anyone for what you are. You’re an adult. If you don’t like something about yourself, only you can change it.)

Kylo Ren/Ben Solo’s character is incredibly complex. I love it so much. He could go either way - towards the light or the dark. But the possibility of reaching a middle ground. OF SOME NEW EMPIRE THAT ACTUALLY WORKS. WOW. That’s just next level. Here’s to hoping we get a strong character out of Ben Solo/Kylo Ren in IX! Make us proud, kid!

*General Solo - A tribute to his mother and his father. Like how couples name their children with a mash of their names.

trail.content_raw:
Author’s note:

While I liked the Ben Solo in Snoke’s Throne Room scene, overall, I prefer JJ Abram’s portrayal of Kylo Ren - strong, intimidating, explosive, beautiful. 

Rian Johnson’s Ben Solo is unkept, soft, all over the place, and rugged-looking.

 I get that Kylo Ren’s character is unraveling, but, idk. The warmer colors. The zero-strength Kylo Ren. 🤔🤔 I don’t understand why Kylo wants Rey to understand him. A lot of things that happened in the movie seemed to be far from organic. 

I love TLJ, either way - for what it is to us Reylo shippers. But for this fic, think TFA-Kylo Ren/Ben Solo.

I mean, even as Kylo was dying, he was still beautiful. LOL. HAHA. A true prince. 

I mean, look at that eyeliner power! Also, he looks so young in TFA. (Just my preference I guess.) :D 

https://archiveofourown.org/works/13426206 (link to the original I posted months ago. I pasted the same story below. 

Hope you like it!

SUPREME LEADER REN.

“Do you think I am still a boy?” He hissed in his deep, menacing voice. His gaze, unfaltering; his tone, resolute as he takes a step towards her. “Do you think I need saving?” He continues in challenge.

“I am neither lost nor in need of saving.” He answers his own question in the woman’s stead. As he approached her, she stood her ground, strong and proud as she always has been; even amid his intimidating physique towering over her. “I do not need your redemption.” He spits at her.

“I am the Supreme Leader because I chose to be.” He ends all doubt, all question about him, his heritage, his conflict. “I am neither Snoke, nor Vader, nor Han Solo.”

“And I am ruler because it is my duty to kill the past. To bury it.”

With his eyes glaring, gleaming with his expressive watery gaze, he tells her, finally, with subtlest hint of tenderness, “Do not fear for me, mother. For there is nothing I have been more certain of than this role cast upon me.”

Finally, Leia’s straight, unfazed expression breaks. Her wrinkled lips quirk. And a light flashes through her eyes. It seemed, as it always had been, that the connection Han and Ben never had; she and Ben always shared. So, as her final words to the son she had always loved, to the son she had lost, and to the son she had found, she tells him with her coarse, aged voice, “Then, rule.”

At her words, at the sound of her voice so close to him after all these years, Ben involuntarily swallows the lump lodged in his throat; his Adam’s apple, bobbing down and back. The taste in his mouth, soured by grief, by the guilt of making her suffer for so long.

“Rule, Ben; righteously, justly, and fully.”

Then, Leia reaches up, to cup her son’s cheek; the warmth of his face, the way he fell into her touch, filled her chest with a fullness she’s known only once before; when she first held him in her arms.

Ben raises his hand and gently holds on to his mother’s spotted, aged one. And tenderly, he vows to her in farewell, “I will.” Then, his lips quirking like Leia’s, like his strong-willed mother, says, “After all, I’ve had the best teacher.”

You’ve thrust him upon men; doubting yourself, your ability to bring him home. All he ever needed was you, Leia. I’ve never met anyone so strong, so beautiful, and able as you. I only pray our son should be half as lucky as I am - to have met someone like you.

To salvage whatever morsel was left of our family, I was willing to sacrifice my life; as I have. I only hope our son knows, just how much he means to us - to me.

Tricky it is, the relationship of a father and son. Tender, that of a son and his mother. Where the latter is filled with love and compassion, the other is filled with disappointment, competition, and unrivaled expectation.

“Your father-” Her voice choked, amid the stifling cold air, her ragged breathing, the erupting Starkiller Base. “-He loved you! And you - you -”

His eyes widen, for less than a second, the image of his father, breaking into a smile, flashed through his eyes. For an instant, the man wondered - did the egotistical, money-hungry scoundrel think he would run away with him? From everything he’s achieved?

“You monster!”

No. A voice in his mind speaks, deep, familiar, - dead.

His father had come to him to show him how deeply he loved him - that for him, he was willing to give up his life, his past, - his future.

The cracking of the falling trees, the thundering blasts and explosions around him, once again, he hisses as he pulls himself up and, with a full fist, hits his side, deep velvet blood dripping from his suit to the white winter snow; embracing the searing pain from his fresh wound, fueling himself with the burning agony.

This love, the deep love of his fallen father, Ben Solo will never know.

“I love him, Leia.” Han breaks into his wife’s tender embrace.

And with a soft voice, herself unsure, she tells him nonetheless, “He knows.”

“Where,” the young Ben Solo’s voice broke, afraid to ask, to know the truth in what he feared. “Am I to go?” Fear - it always seemed to find him.

“To train with your uncle Luke,” His mother pets his fluffy dark hair, her smile, not quite reaching her beautiful brown eyes. “To become a Jedi Knight like your uncle, like your grandfather before him.” She tells him proudly.

Wide eyes look past his mother’s tender gaze to his father’s hard, conflicted ones, surprised by the expression in the boy’s face - asking him a question he did not understand, searching for an answer he did not know.

So, instead, and rather lamely, Han tells his pre-adolescent son, “Give them hell, kid.”

Ben’s eyes fall to the ground in disappointment, nodding halfheartedly.

“Is that all you’re bringing?” Luke pops out from his spaceshuttle, a grin plastered on his young, jovial face; gesturing to the calligraphy set between young Ben Solo’s arm.

The boy gives a small smile, nodding. And, with a simple wave of the hand, his uncle calls him over, unaware of the friend his nephew had brought along; whispering lies and deceit into his ear.

“It is dead.” Ben Solo now tells her amid the blood, metallic in stench, drying at the side of his head. The noise of the war stilled around them. “The Sith and the Jedi.” And, for the third time, he raises his hand to her in offer, “Rule with me, Rey.”

Promise me, Ben. Rule with righteousness, justice, and with your whole being.

Ben’s tender gaze, never once before her, faltered as he tells her again, and again, “I swear it.”

Uniform footsteps stop with a snap before him. Ben Solo turns from his commanding bridge and nods to his reporting military officers.

“General Solo.” An amphibious humanoid salutes him. “We’ve arrived.”

END.

Author’s note:

General Solo, what a tribute to his parent’s legacy! It would be incredible to see him addressed this manner in canon. (General Leia Organa + Han Solo) And no trace of the toxic/burdensome Skywalker name!! :oooooo

A snippet on what I see in Kylo Ren/Ben Solo’s character. I have great hopes for him. Also, I don’t want his character development to depend on another person - that’s just unrealistic. You grow because of yourself, because you chose it. All your actions return to you and what you’ve done. The best people around you can do is to influence you. But, that’s just it - it’s by your choice that you allow them to influence your character. (That’s how I live my life/perceive things actually, lol. As an adult, you can’t blame anyone for what you are. You’re an adult. If you don’t like something about yourself, only you can change it.)

Kylo Ren/Ben Solo’s character is incredibly complex. I love it so much. He could go either way - towards the light or the dark. But the possibility of reaching a middle ground. OF SOME NEW EMPIRE THAT ACTUALLY WORKS. WOW. That’s just next level. Here’s to hoping we get a strong character out of Ben Solo/Kylo Ren in IX! Make us proud, kid!

*General Solo - A tribute to his mother and his father. Like how couples name their children with a mash of their names.

blog.name: ao3feed-starwars

An AO3 Feed for the Star Wars - All Media Types tag.

Icon from the Star Wars App.

title: Mission: Assassination on Tarrigone
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2ztmSQW

by king_arthur_ii

This is something a little different to your normal Star Wars short fic. For one, it’s completely OC based. I wanted to experiment with how well I could write for the Star Wars universe without using any of the existing characters. And secondly, it’s from the perspective of a First Order soldier, something that’s done not nearly as often as for example a Jedi or a rebel. Follow special ops trooper AG-424 as he struggles to escape the seemingly doomed situation that his commanding officer has landed him in.

Words: 1161, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

Series: Part 1 of The Trials and Experiences of a First Order Special Operative

  • Fandoms: Star Wars - All Media Types, Star Wars Sequel Trilogy
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply
  • Characters: The First Order (Star Wars), Original First Order Character(s) (Star Wars)
  • Additional Tags: Original Character(s)


read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2ztmSQW

blog.name: iskelan
blog.title: Artistically autistic
blog.description: It's Hess'kela'nuruodo, but you may call me Alex. 30 y.o.. Russia. Autistic. Sociophobic. Queer. Sci-fi fan. Loves all kinds of aliens, especially blue. Attempts to draw.

tags: I just needed an excuse to draw Thrawn with wings
summary: Fusion-crossover of Thrawn (Star Wars) and Janos Audron (Legacy of Kain) that just has to exist. I wish I could draw it better....
caption: Fusion-crossover of Thrawn (Star Wars) and Janos Audron (Legacy of Kain) that just has to exist. I wish I could draw it better. But anyway Thrawn looks good as a Nosgoth vampire.

summary: Chapter 36 is out, which means it is time for some bonding exercises! I don't think Tumblr has fixed the linking issue of not...
body:
Chapter 36 is out, which means it is time for some bonding exercises! I don’t think Tumblr has fixed the linking issue of not showing any posts with links in them in searches, so once again: you can find the links for this chapter and for the beginning of the fic in the notes section of this post! Again, I’m so sorry for such an inconvenient way to access the fic, but I have yet to figure out a better way. I keep hoping that the staff will change their minds about this, but I’m not holding my breath.

On a more positive note: You can now support me on ko-fi! The link to my page can be found in the notes as well.

Be My Prize

Poe Dameron/Kylo Ren, Poe Dameron/Finn

Poe Dameron is forced to take a vacation and has to leave the Resistance base, and he is not exactly thrilled about it. He soon meets a stranger, who is the definition of “tall, dark, and handsome”, and they are both fascinated with each other. The vacation is suddenly starting to seem less and less like a bore.

However, things can only go downhill from here, when one of the interested parties is a Resistance pilot and the other hails the flag of the First Order.

—

The story starts before the events of The Force Awakens and continues past the the movie.

The fic will update every Saturday until I run out of my buffer, though I will attempt to continue the weekly schedule even after that happens.
